intro: Thalictrum minus subsp. caesium, commonly known as the lesser meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and establish itself in suitable habitats. Thalictrum minus subsp. caesium is often found in the temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
